turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jacob.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Okay, Jacob, get up and sit your ass down on the bed. Make a wrong move and I'll shoot you in the face.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What's the story with you two? You a couple of fags?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He's my son.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: How does that happen? You don't look Japanese.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Neither does he. He looks Vietnamese.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Oh, well, excuse me all to hell.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's this about, money?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: It's about money, all right, but not yours. You see, me and my brother here are in a little hot water and we need your assistance.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's okay, honey. Everything's going to be all right.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Just listen to daddy, sugar, and don't do nothin' stupid.  You two, Simon says sit the fuck down!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Where are the keys to the motor home?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: On the dresser.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Richie, take the keys. Start that big bastard up, and drive it up front.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Not a chance.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: If you're taking people, take me. But my kids aren't going anywhere with you.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Sorry, I need everybody.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: My children are not going with you, and that's that.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: That's not fuckin' that...  this is fuckin' this.  Go sit over there.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Good.  Your old man's all right, he just saved your life.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Jacob Fuller. Jacob, that's biblical, ain't it? What am I askin' for, of course it is.  What are their names?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Scott and Kate.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: My wife.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Where is the little lady?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: In heaven.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: She's dead?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes, she is.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: How'd she die?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Auto wreck.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Come on, gimme some more details. How'd it happen? Some fuckin' drunk kill her?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. It was a rainy night, the brakes on the car weren't great. She had to stop suddenly. She slid on the road, she crashed, she died.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Died instantly?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Not quite. She was trapped in the wreck for about six hours before she passed on.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Whewww! Those acts of God really stick it in and break it off, don't they?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes, they do.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Is this real?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I've seen one of these before. A friend of mine had himself declared a minister of his own religion. Away to fuck the IRS. Is that what you're doing, or are you the real McCoy?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Real McCoy.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You're a preacher?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I was a minister.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Was? As in not anymore?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Why'd ya quit?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I think I've gotten about as up close and personal with you as I'm gonna get. Now if you need me like I think you need me, you're not gonna kill me 'cause I won't answer your stupid, prying questions. So, with all due respect, mind your own business.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I seem to have touched a nerve. Don't be so sensitive, Pops, let's keep this friendly. But you're right, enough with the getting to know you shit.  Now, there's two ways we can play this hand. One way is me and you go round an' round all fuckin' night. The other way, is we reach some sort of an understanding. Now, if we go down that first path at the end of the day, I'll win. But we go down the second, we'll both win. Now, I don't give a rat's ass about you or your fuckin' family. Y'all can live forever or die this second and I don't care which. The only things I do care about are me that son-of-a-bitch in the back, and our money. And right now I need to get those three things into Mexico. Now, stop me if I'm wrong, but I take it you don't give a shit about seeing me and my brother receiving justice, or the bank getting its money back. Right now all you care about is the safety of your daughter, your son and possibly yourself. Am I correct?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I thought so. You help us get across the border without incident, stay with us the rest of the night without trying anything funny, and in the morning we'll let you and your family go. That way everybody gets what they want. You and your kids get out of this alive and we get into Mexico. Everybody's happy.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: How do I know you'll keep your word?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Pops, don't start with this shit.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You want me to sit here and be passive. The only way being passive in this situation makes sense is if I believe you'll let us go. I'm not there yet. You have to convince me you're telling the truth.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Look, dickhead, the only thing you need to be convinced about is that you're stuck in a situation with a coupla real mean motor scooters. I don't wanna hafta worry about you all fuckin' night. And I don't think you wanna be worrying about my brother's intentions toward your daughter all night. You notice the way he looked at her, didn't ya?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Didn't like it, did ya?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No, I didn't.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Didn't think so. So, as I was saying, I'm willing to make a deal. You behave, get us into Mexico, and don't try to escape. I'll keep my brother off your daughter and let you all loose in the morning.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You won't let him touch her?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I can handle Richie, don't worry.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: If he touches her, I'll kill him. I don't give a fuck how many guns you have, nothing will stop me from killing him.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Fair enough. You break your word, I'll kill all of you.  Kate, honey!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Swear to God, on the Bible, you won't try to escape and you'll get us across the border.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I swear to God I won't try to escape and I'll do my best to get you into Mexico.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You best better get it done, Pops.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm telling you, don't hurt her.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: As long as you're cool, she'll be cool. What're ya gonna say?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't have the slightest idea.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Well, you just keep thinkin' of that gun next to Kate's temple.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: We did our part, we gotcha in Mexico. Now it's time for your part, letting us go.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Pops, when you're right, you're right, and you are right.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Then?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Then stop, 'cause that's where we're going.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Out of the stew pot and into the fire.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Shit, I been to bars make this place look like a fuckin' 4-H club.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Who else?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Pass.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Why not, against your religion?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No, I do drink, I'm just not drinking now.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Suit yourself, more for me.  Scotty?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Why are you so agitated?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I'm still stewing about that ape laying hands on me. And that fuckin' bartender sticks a weed up my ass, too.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He backed down.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: He's smilin' at us. But behind his smile, he's sayin', "Fuck you Jack." I hear that loud and clear.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I'm gonna just sit here and drain this bottle. And when I've drunk the last drop, if I still feel then, the way I feel now, I'm gonna take this bottle and break it over his melon head.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Before we stepped in here, you told all of us to be cool. That means you, too.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I never said do what I do, I said do what I say.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Are you so much a fucking loser, you can't tell when you've won?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What did you call me?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Nothing. I didn't make a statement. I asked a question. Would you like me to ask it again? Very well. Are you such a loser you can't tell when you've won?  The entire state of Texas, along with the FBI, is looking for you. Did they find you? No. They couldn't. They had every entrance to the border covered. There's no way you could get across. Did you? Yes, you did. You've won, Seth, enjoy it.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: To your family.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: To yours.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Now, is your shit together?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Forever together.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Okay, does anybody here know what's going on?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yeah, I know what's going on. We got a bunch of fuckin' vampires outside trying to get inside and suck our fuckin' blood! That's it, plain and simple. And I don't wanna hear any bullshit about "I don't believe in vampires" because I don't fuckin' believe in vampires either. But I do believe in my own two fuckin' eyes, and with my two eyes I saw fuckin' vampires! Now, does everybody agree we're dealin' with vampires.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You too, preacher?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm like you. I don't believe in vampires, but I believe in what I saw.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Good for you. Now, since we all believe we're dealing with vampires, what do we know about vampires? Crosses hurt vampires. Do you have a cross?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: In the Winnebago.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: In other words, no.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I don't know about that. In order for it to have any power, I think it's gotta be an official crucifix.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's an official cross? Some piece of tin made in Taiwan? What makes that official? If a cross works against vampires, it's not the cross itself, it's what the cross represents. The cross is a symbol of holiness.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Okay, I'll buy that. So we got crosses covered, moving right along, what else?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Did he...?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You all are gonna fuckin' die! I'm gonna fuckin' kill every last one of you godless pieces of shit!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You bet your sweet ass you are, and I'm gonna help you do it. But we ain't got much time.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's this stuff?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: My guess is that this little dive's been feeding on nomad road waifs like bikers and truckers for a longtime. This is probably some of the shipments they stole off the trucks.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Well, I say lets tear this place apart for weapons. So when they burst through that door, we'll make 'em wish they never did.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I don't give a shit about living or dying anymore. I just want to send as many of these devils back to hell as I can.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Amen.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I promise.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Kate, Scott?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's the bitterest of pills.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You two ought to start a stand-up act, because you're just wasting your humor on me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Ain't it the truth.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I just bet you would. Don't even think about it. Besides, I want to have one night's sleep in an honest- to-goodness bed. The beds in the home are okay, but they're not like a real bed.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Hey, if we go to a motel, we can swim.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Dad, when I called the machine to check our messages there was one from Bethel Baptist. Mr. Franklin said he wouldn't permanently replace you until we came back. He said when we come home, if you still feel the same way --

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: That's very nice of Ted, but I'll call him tomorrow and tell him not to bother waiting.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I didn't want to talk about this in front of Scott because he gets upset. But you don't believe in God anymore?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Not enough to be a pastor. Look, I know this is hard on you kids. After Jenny's death, this is probably the last thing you need. But I can't do it any longer. My congregation needs spiritual leadership. Well, they can't get that from me anymore. My faith is gone. To answer your question, yes, I do believe in Jesus. But do I love them? No. After Jenny died, I just thought, what's the point?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's just, all our lives you've been a pastor. For twenty years you've preached trust in the lord. And then one day you wake up and say fuck him?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I didn't say fuck him. I'm just not connected anymore.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That happens, you'll get it back.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Kate, give your old man a little credit. Every person who chooses the service of God as their life's work has something in common. I don't care if you're a preacher, a priest, a nun, a rabbi or a Buddhist monk. Many, many times during your life you'll look at your reflection in the mirror and ask yourself, am I a fool? We've all done it. I'm not going through a lapse. What I've experienced is closer to awakening. I'm not trying to shake your faith. I've just decided not to devote my life to God anymore.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What do you think Mom would say?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Mom's got nothing to say, she's dead.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: There's nothing wrong with this place.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's a flop house.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's not a flop house. It's basic and simple. That doesn't make it a flop house.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: If it doesn't have a pool, we're looking for a new place.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It has a bed. That's all I care about.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Other places have beds, they also have cable TV, a gym, room service...

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: About two hours from now.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So all we have to do is get by for a few more hours and then we can walk right out the front door.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You're gonna be okay, aren't you, daddy?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No, I'm not. I've been bit. In effect, I'm already dead.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I promise.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Scott?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Kate, we don't have all day, so I'm only gonna count to five. One...two... three... four...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Okay, okay, I promise I'll do it!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Not good enough, swear to God.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I swear to God, our father, that when you change into one of the undead, I will kill you.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Good girl. Now, Scott, we have even less time, so I'm only giving you the count of three. One...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'm going for 'em!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Everybody goes home!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: We're having a wet bikini contest, and you just won.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Richie, will you do me a favor and eat my pussy?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Where are you taking us?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Mexico.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's in Mexico?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Mexicans.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: In the room. Were you serious, or were you just foolin' around? I'm just bringing it up, 'cause if you really want me to do that for you, I will.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What you said to me in the room.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What did I say?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: You asked me if I would --

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Creepy guy.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: The Sword of Damocles is lifted from above Seth's head. He's just solved a problem that a mere thirty seconds ago seemed unsolvable. He knows exactly how he's going to cross the border. Whistling a happy tune, he turns and walks back into room #9.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You got three minutes. One second longer, I shoot your father in the face. Do you understand what I just said?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Do you believe me?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You damn well better. Go.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You must have a bible in here, don't cha?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah, we got a bible.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Get it and bring it up here, will ya, please?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You're gonna let us go?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: In the morning, darlin', in the morning, we are G-O-N-E and you are F-R-E-E. Now, I know I put you guys through hell, and I know I've been one rough pecker, but from here on end you guys are in my cool book. Scotty, help me pick Richie up, and lay him down. Jacob, keep going on this road till you get to a sign that says, "Digayo." When you get to Digayo, turn this big bastard left, go on down for a few miles, then you see a bar called "The Titty Twister." From what I hear, you can't miss it.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: How about you, cutie pie? Ready for round two?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Peachy! Why shouldn't I be? The world's my oyster, except for the fact that I just rammed a wooden stake in my brother's heart because he turned into a vampire, even though I don't believe in vampires. Aside from that unfortunate business, everything's hunky-dory.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'm really sorry.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Bullshit! You hate us. If you had half a chance you'd feed us to them!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We have to go back for Daddy!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Daddy's dead.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Noooo!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Watch my back!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Anytime.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: How many bullets left, kid?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Not many.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Well, when you run out of weapons, just start cold cocking 'em. Make 'em sing for their supper.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Should I use the last bullets on us?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You use 'em on the first couple of these parasites that try to bite you.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: See ya.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Later.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Why, just look at all this. You got your kitchen --

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: -- you got your microwave --

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: -- you got your sink --

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: -- you got your shower --

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: -- see this, television!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Feel this, real wood paneling. That's real wood, too, not that fake stuff.

turns.speaker: STANLEY CHASE
turns.text: For the time being we are very confident we will apprehend the fugitives in the next forty-eight hours. The Bureau, local law enforcement and the Texas Rangers have all joined forces in forming a dragnet to snare Seth and Richard Gecko.

turns.speaker: KELLY HOUGE
turns.text: Agent Chase, does it appear that they are heading for Mexico.

turns.speaker: STANLEY CHASE
turns.text: Yes, it does, Kelly. We have already alerted the Mexican authorities. They intend to cooperate every way possible in bringing these fugitives to justice.

turns.speaker: KELLY HOUGE
turns.text: Are you optimistic about the safety of the hostage they took in Abilene, Gloria Hill?

turns.speaker: STANLEY CHASE
turns.text: We've received no news one way or the other. We can only hope for the best.

turns.speaker: KELLY HOUGE
turns.text: What about the report from an eyewitness at the liquor store who said one of the brothers was shot?

turns.speaker: STANLEY CHASE
turns.text: This can't be confirmed at this time, but we do believe it to be true. We have reason to believe it was the youngest brother Richard, and he was shot in the vicinity of his neck and shoulders by the store's clerk.

turns.speaker: KELLY HOUGE
turns.text: Is it safe to assume that because the death count involved and the loss of life of law enforcement officers, that the Bureau, the Rangers and the police force are taking this manhunt personally?

turns.speaker: STANLEY CHASE
turns.text: I would say that's a very safe assumption.

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: Hot goddamn day!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Haven't felt it a bit. Been inside with the air conditioner blastin' all day long.

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: Not even for lunch?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I'm by myself today, ate my lunch outta the microwave.

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: Jesus Christ man, that microwave food will kill ya as quick as a bullet. Those burritos are only fit for a hippie high on weed. Pull me down a bottle of Jack Daniels. I'm gettin' tanked tonight.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Whatsamatter?

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: Awww, it's just been a shitass day. Every inch of it hot and miserable. First off, Nadine at the Blue Chip got some sorta sick, so that Mongoloid boy of hers was workin' the grill. That fuckin' idiot don't know rat shit from Rice Krispies. I ate breakfast at nine, was pukin' up pigs in a blanket like a sick dog by ten thirty.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Isn't there a law or something against retards serving food to the public?

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: Well, if there ain't there sure oughta be. Who knows what goes on inside Mongoloid's mind?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: You could sue the shit out of her, ya know. That kid belongs under a circus tent, not flippin' burgers. You could own that fuckin' place.

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: What the hell would I do with that grease pit? Besides, Nadine's got enough of a cross to bear just taking care of that potato head. Then all this Abilene shit happened. You heard about that bank robbery in Abilene, didn't ya?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: That's all that's been on the box all day. They killed some people didn't they?

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: Four Rangers, three cops, and two civilians. And they took a lady bank teller as a hostage.

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: They'll probably make a run for the border, which would bring 'em this way. And if we get our hands on those shit asses, we're talking payback time. We'll get 'em all right. I gotta piss. I'm gonna use your commode.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Knock yourself out.

turns.speaker: MCGRAW
turns.text: Yeah, and I'm gonna be right back at it tomorrow. So tonight I'm gonna sit in front of the box and just drink booze. How much is the bottle?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Six-fifty.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What do you want from me? I did what you said.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Letting him use your toilet? No store does that.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: He comes in here every day and we bullshit. He's used my toilet a thousand times. If I told him no, he'd know something was up.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I want that son-of-a-bitch out outta here, in his car, and down the road or you can change the name of this place to "Benny's World of Blood."

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Were you giving that pig signals?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What? Are you kidding? I didn't do anything!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: He says you were scratching.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I wasn't scratching!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You callin' him a liar?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I never said help us!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Well that don't matter now, 'cause you got about two fuckin' seconds to live! Richie!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Whiskey!

turns.speaker: RAZOR CHARLIE
turns.text: You can't come in here.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What dya mean?

turns.speaker: RAZOR CHARLIE
turns.text: This is a private club. You're not welcome.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Are you tellin' me I'm not good enough to drink here?

turns.speaker: RAZOR CHARLIE
turns.text: This bar is for bikers and truckers only.  You, get out!

turns.speaker: RAZOR CHARLIE
turns.text: Best in Mexico.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I kinda doubt that. We're grabbin' a table, send over a waitress to take our order.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What the fuck was that about?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: He signaled the Ranger.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What the fuck is wrong with you --

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Seth, he did it. You were by the beer cooler with your back turned. I was by the magazines, I could see his face.  And I saw him mouth:

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Start the car.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: You believe me don't cha?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Shut up and start the car.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Richie? You okay?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I'm not dead, but I'm definitely shot! I told you that bastard said, "Help us!"

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: When I count three, shoot out the bottles behind him!

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Gotcha!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: One... Two... Three.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What did I tell you? What did I tell you? Buy the road map and leave.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What am I supposed to do, Seth? He recognized us.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: He didn't recognize shit.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Do they have cable?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Do they have an X-rated channel?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Do they have a waterbed?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: They don't have anything except four walls and a roof, and that's all we need.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: How's it feel?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: How ya think, it hurts like a son-of- a-bitch.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I got both rooms on either side of us, so we don't gotta worry about eavesdropping assholes. How's that feel? You okay?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Feels good.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I'm gonna go get the money.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Hey, when you talk to him, see if you can arrange a better deal than thirty percent.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: That's their standard deal, brother. They ain't about to change it for us.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Did you even to try to negotiate?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: These guys ain't spic firecracker salesman from Tijuana. They don't even know the meaning of the word "barter".  You wanna stay in El Ray? You give them thirty percent of your loot. It's scripture. So it is written, so shall it be done. You want sanctuary, you pay the price, and the price is thirty percent.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: All I'm saying --

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: -- This conversation is over.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Shit, I started to get worried. Where the fuck ya been?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Sight seein'.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What'd ya see?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Cops.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Didya look at the border?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yeah, I saw the border. Through binoculars from on top of a high building. That's about as close as I risked getting. What's the TV say?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: They're going to apprehend us in forty-eight hours.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I gotta figure a way to get across that goddamn border. Longer we fuck around El Paso our lives ain't worth a shit.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Look, fuck the border. Let's just dig in and wait for things to cool down.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Richie, it's gonna get a lot fuckin' worse before it gets any fuckin' better. We showed our ass in Texas. We killed Texas fuckin' Rangers. They ain't gonna stop lookin' till they find us, and when they find us, they're gonna kill us. Texans take it very personal when ya kill their law enforcement officers. The El Paso police have already started a motel and hotel search for us.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I heard it on the radio. We gotta get our asses into Mexico tonight. Carlos is gonna meet us tomorrow morning at a rendezvous on the other side, then Carlos and his boys will escort us to El Ray and --

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Where's the woman?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What'd ya mean, what? The fuckin' woman, the hostage. Where the fuck is she, Richard!?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: She's in the other room.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What the fuck is she doin' there?!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yeah, explain it to me. I need an explanation. What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: There's nothing wrong with me, brother. That woman tried to escape and I did what I had to do.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: No.  That woman wouldn't of said shit if she had a mouthful.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong! Once you left, she became a whole different person.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Is it me? Is it my fault?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: It's not your fault, it's her fault!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Is this my fault? Do you think this is what I am?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: This is not me! I am a professional fucking thief. I steal money. You try to stop me, god help you. But I don't kill people I don't have to, and I don't rape women. What you doin' ain't how it's done. Do you understand?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Seth, if you were me --

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Just say yes! Nothing else, just say yes.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yes, Seth, I understand.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yes, Seth, I understand.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Richard!

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: This isn't gonna work.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Shut up. It's gonna work just fine,

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I just want to go on record as saying this is a bad idea.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Duly noted. Now, shut up.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: They're gonna search the van.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: As long as you don't act like a fuckin' nut, we'll be just fine.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: You just called me a fuckin' nut.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: No, I didn't.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yes, you did. You said as long as I don't act like a fuckin' nut, implying that I've been acting like a fuckin' nut.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Take a pill, kid. I just meant stay cool.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: You meant that, but you meant the other, too.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: This ain't the time, Richard.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Fuck those spic pigs! You called me a fuckin' nut, and where I come from, that stops the train on its tracks.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Keep your voice down.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Or what?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I'm curious. What was the nuttiest thing I did?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: This ain't the time.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Oh, I know, was it possibly when your ass was rotting in jail and I broke it out? Yeah, you're right, that was pretty fuckin' nutty. Not to mention stupid. But you know what? I can fix that right now.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yeah, I think so. What happened?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I don't know, you just passed out.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yeah, we were just standing there. You said something about your shoulder hurting, then you just hit the ground like a sack of potatoes.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yeah, when you fell your head smacked the toilet hard. It scared the shit outta me. Sure you're okay?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yeah, I guess. I'm just a little fucked up.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Well, let me tell ya something, gonna clear your head right up. We are officially Mexicans.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: We are...  "South of the border down Mexico way."

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: We are?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yep. We're heading for the rendezvous right now. We get there, we pound booze till Carlos shows up, he escorts us to El Ray. And then me and you, brother, kick fuckin' back. How ya like them apples?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Far out.  Where are my glasses?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: They broke when you fell.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Oh, fuck, Seth, that's my only pair!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Don't worry about it, we'll get you some glasses.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: What dya mean, don't worry about it. Of course I'm gonna worry about it, I can't fuckin' see.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: When we get to El Ray, I'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yeah, like a Mexican hole-in-the- wall's gonna have my fuckin' prescription.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: It's not a big deal, unless you make it a big deal. Now, I'm real happy, Richie, stop bringing me down with bullshit.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: That's what you think?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: That's how you're lookin', Richie.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I'm lookin' scared?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: That's what you look like.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: You know what you look like?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: No, Richie, what do I look like?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: You're lookin' green.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Where are you right now?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I'm here with you.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: No, you're not. You're sippin' margaritas in El Ray. But we're not in El Ray. We're here -- getting ready to go in there. You're so pleased with yourself about getting into Mexico, you think the job's down. It ain't. Get back on the clock. That's a fuck-with-you-bar. We hang around there for a coupla hours, in all likelihood, we'll get fucked with. So get your shit together, brother.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: My shit is together.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: It don't look together.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Well, it is. Just because I'm happy doesn't mean I'm on vacation. You're just not used to seein' me happy, 'cause it's been about fifteen fuckin' years since I been happy. But my shit is forever together.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Earth to Richie. Don't you wanna ask your new friend to join us?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Well, then ask her, dumb ass.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Por favor, Senorita. Would you care to join us?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Scarred for life, that's how I am!

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: How 'bout you?  You are safer in here with us than wandering around a Mexican border town all night long. Just don't do nothin' stupid and we'll all get along fine.  Scotty, you sure you don't want a drink?

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Okay, I'll have one.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: In that camper out there I saw a guitar. I take it that's yours.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Yeah, it's mine.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Go out and bring it in. I feel a song coming on.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: You could take their head off.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Actually, our best weapon against these satanic cocksuckers is this man.  He's a preacher.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: He's right, Kate. Daddy's dead! He was too far away. If flinging that door and filling this room with those bat-things would save him, I'd fling it. The only thing it'll do is turn us into one of them.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: He needs our help!

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: He's beyond our help. You saw him get bit. I saw him get bit. We all saw it. You can't help him. I've got no one left to lose but you. I can't be alone again. We're sticking together.

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: B.O.Q., south side.  Take a starboard tack out the door.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thank you, ensign.

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: No problem, lieutenant.

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: They take you away to San Clemente Island.  Half the guys quit when they come back.  Supposed to be just hell-and-a-half.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: That's what I hear.

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Can I ask you somethin', lieutenant? How come you're doing this?  I mean, we're kinda curious.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Who's "we"?

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Just some of the women.
